item.title: Timing
item.dc:creator: @Mendorphinz Mendorphinz
item.description:
@Mendorphinz wrote:

Hey.

I want to click on a door, start an animation, then teleport in to the building and then do some forcedChat, one after another.

I used (System.currentTimeMilis() - name > ####) and set a time for every action, but it would just do everything in less than a second. I did delete it but I just quickly typed it up again to give you a example

if (objectId == 4487 || (objectId == 4490)) {
		
		if (System.currentTimeMillis() - FFDoor > 1000) {
			int FFDoor = System.currentTimeMillis();

			startAnimation(######);
                               }
		if (System.currentTimeMillis() - FFDoor > 3000) {
			getPA().movePlayer(3427, 3538, 0);
                                }
		if (System.currentTimeMillis() - FFDoor > 4500) {
			forcedChat("Woah, what was that...");
					}
				}

So, I want to execute each action after a certain time so they go through one after another and not all at once. Any help please?

Oh, and can I do

if (System.currentTimeMillis() > 1000) {

or does it have to have “- FFDoor”?

And does “FFDoor” have to be a method or is it okay like it is?

Read full topic
